resources.string: Mood Journal will now be able to receive your phone interaction events such as click, back, home.
Permission required to access interaction with phone.
We do not collect any sensitive data. We just use this to infer interaction with phone.
Click the button below to open your accessibility settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.
Permission required to access interaction with apps.
We just use this to infer acceptance and dismissal of a notification by checking if the corresponding app was launched.
Click the button below to open your app settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.
We do not collect any sensitive data and all data are anonymised.
Click the button below to open your notification settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.

Mood Journal helps you to keep track of your mood everyday. The app will trigger one mood related questionnaire every day. All the personal information will be anonymised, securely transmitted and stored on the server. No additional information related to contacts \(telephone numbers, email addresses etc.\) on your device or history of communication made with the contact would be collected by the application. The app is developed to collect data for research at University of Birmingham.
\n\n
By agreeing to the consent below, I confirm that I am over 18 years of age and allow the app to collect my data. I also confirm that I am the sole prominent user of this device. I understand that access to any data collected will only be allowed to me and the researchers team at University of Birmingham. Any published results of this study will only refer to anonymised and obfuscated data, and aggregated statistics that do not reveal the identities of the participants. As a participant, I have the right to opt out of the data collection at any time during this experiment by uninstalling the application. Moreover, I have the right to access any information in the data set related to me, and request for any part of that data to be removed.
You have not tracked your mood for today.
Good job! You have tracked your mood for today. You can do it again tomorrow.

Extroversion (E) is the personality trait of seeking fulfillment from sources outside the self or in community. High scorers tend to be very social while low scorers prefer to work on their projects alone.


Agreeableness (A) reflects much individuals adjust their behavior to suit others. High scorers are typically polite and like people. Low scorers tend to 'tell it like it is'.


Conscientiousness (C) is the personality trait of being honest and hardworking. High scorers tend to follow rules and prefer clean homes. Low scorers may be messy and cheat others.


Neuroticism (N) is the personality trait of being emotional.


Openness (O) is the personality trait of seeking new experience and intellectual pursuits. High scores may day dream a lot. Low scorers may be very down to earth.

You cannot go back to change your answer. It is not mandatory to completely the test in one go. So, take your time and try to answer the questions as accurate as possible.
\n\n Note that this test uses the Big-Five Factor Markers from the International Personality Item Pool, developed by Goldberg (1992). These big five personality traits that are most commonly used model of personality in academic psychology.
Thank you!

string-array.name: personality_test_questions
string-array.item: I am the life of the party.
I feel little concern for others.
I am relaxed most of the time.
I have difficulty understanding abstract ideas.
I make a mess of things.
I am not interested in abstract ideas.
I am not interested in other people\'s problems.
I get chores done right away.
I often forget to put things back in their proper place.
I do not have a good imagination.
I talk to a lot of different people at parties.
I am not really interested in others.
I change my mood a lot.
I am quick to understand things.
I don\'t like to draw attention to myself.
I take time out for others.
I don\'t mind being the center of attention.
I spend time reflecting on things.
I make people feel at ease.
I am exacting in my work.

resources.string: Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

string-array.name: phq_test_questions
string-array.item: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Feeling tired or having little energy?
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed?

resources.string: Over the last few hours, what is your mood level?

Do you know that tracking your mood regularly could help maintaining your well-being? We will help you form a good habit of tracking mood every day by creating a plan called as implementation intention.


Implementation intention is effective in helping form new habits by specifying the condition to perform your intended habit.


Tap the button below to start.

This is your plan. Now follow these steps:


1. Read your plan below
 2. Repeat it twice in your head
 3. Close your eyes and imagine
Now, fill in the blank space with a condition that trigger your action
Fabulous! You are good to go. Once again, remember your plan below:
Nah, you are wrong! Your plan should be:

Follow these steps:


1. Read your plan below
 2. Repeat it twice in your head
 3. Close your eyes and imagine
When I arrive at home, then I will track my mood
Please indicate how do you feel about tracking your mood every day. Choose the appropriate response for each item.
Brilliant! Now, you are all set up. Don\'t forget your plan: When you %1$s, then you will track my mood.
You cannot go back to change your answer. It is mandatory to complete the test in one go. So, take your time and try to answer the questions as accurate as possible.

string-array.name: gcs_questions
string-array.item: I am strongly committed to pursuing this goal.
I think this is a good goal to aim for.
It would not take much to make me abandon this goal.
Quite frankly, I do not care if I achieve this goal or not.
It is hard to take this goal seriously.

resources.string: Please answer the following questions by choosing the right scale that represents your perception towards completing a mood tracking task as your activity.

You cannot go back to change your answer. It is mandatory to complete the test in one go. So, take your time and try to answer the questions as accurate as possible.
\n\n Note that this test uses SRBAI questionnaire to measure automaticity of behaviour, developed by Gardner et. al. (2012).
Thank you!

string-array.name: srbai_questions
string-array.item: I track my mood without having to consciously remember.
I track my mood without thinking.
I start tracking my mood before I realise I am doing it.

resources.string: Please enable permission requests for read/write access to local storage. We need read/write access permission to store the data in your phone, before transmitting securely into our server.

string-array.name: phq8_results_treatment_actions
string-array.item: Watchful waiting; repeat PHQ-8 at follow-up
Make treatment plan, consider counseling, follow-up, and/or prescription drugs
Prescribe prescription drugs. If there are poor responses to treatment, immediately refer the patient to a mental health specialist for counseling.
